Comment.value:
negative reaction
it's very likely that you could have many characters
refuse to continue conversation after a negative reaction
for the purposes of this demonstration, we'll continue

hostile reaction
about 50% of NPC's can probably end their conversation here
for the purposes of this example, we'll continue
persuasion attempt failed, not the same race as the information giver
persuasion attempt succeeded, not the same race as the information giver

LinkComment.value:
Int 9+

** one assumes that the 'main plot' is the overarching story
for your module that the player already knows something about...
or, at least, some publicly-known event that the player is aware of.

These dialogues also assume that there are at least three major elements
to the main plot that can be asked about.  If there aren't, extras can be deleted.
As well, if the player doesn't start off knowing about the 'main plot', a script could
easily be added to the question that links into these (the 'I'm curious about some recent
events...') that only makes the option available once the player has been told
about the plot. **

Cha 11+, Int 9+
(charisma generally allows more dialogue options to be
made available to the player, as you can generally chat
with people for longer periods.  Note that this is seperate
from plot givers, who give players required info, not optional
info.]

Cha 11+, Int 9+
(charisma generally allows more dialogue options to be
made available to the player, as you can generally chat
with people for longer periods.  Note that this is seperate
from plot givers, who give players required info, not optional
info.]
